result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
MAT program. Defendant to continue MAT program after serving condition time.
Parenting classes.
Cognitive Invention Program.
Restorative Justice Program.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

No contact with victims and victims residence. State to file Order.
No contact with firearms.

Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments.  To be paid including DNA surcharge during the period of probation.  If revoked to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: 25 hours of community served. 25 hours per year and to be completed during probation.

charges.descr: Burglary Of A Building or Dwelling

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Nathaniel Howard Guard.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 8 YEARS, concurrent to case 22CF678, with credit for 220 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 4 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 4 YEARS.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Serve 1 YEAR in House of Correction as Condition Time.
-MAT program; defendant to continue MAT program after serving condition time. 
-Parenting classes.
-Cognitive Intervention Program.
-Restorative Justice Program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victims and victims residence; State to file order. 
-Vocational Training.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-25 Hours community service; 25 hours per year and to be completed during probation. 
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid, including DNA surcharge, during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction, filed.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Nathaniel Howard Guard.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 3: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case heard in Branch 36 for global resolution of cases.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Graber appeared by video for Nathaniel Howard Guard.  Attorney Patrick J Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant denied from drug treatment court.  Defendant has other pending matters in Branch 36.  State provided global offer to Defense.  Court accepts transfer of cases from Branch 36.  Court also allows transfer of this case to Branch 36 for global resolution.  State believes this matter should be re-tabbed to Branch 36 as that branch has a lower pending matter.  Parties will continue to discuss the matter.  Case adjourned for a status conference in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense seeking DTC entry and requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court by video with Attorney Katherine Graber who appears in person.  Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF2539. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Schwabenlander. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel  filed.

Court ordered no contact with MCS or her residence
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Nathaniel Howard Guard in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nathaniel Howard Guard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
